dialogues.text: No, no. That's just not the way things  are done. Besides, how's he know I  don't just get in there see there's  too many and just serve em their  fuckin' food and beat it?

dialogues.text: He knows you, man. He knows all you  want is to move up. That's all. A  smooth hitter woulda gone in there,  seen it was a wash and slipped out.  But a guy like you? Knowin' this is  your only chance? Waitin' eighteen  years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No man. That's... that's... you  don't know what you're talking about.  That's bullshit. I know these guys.  I mean, thanks for your concern, but  that just ain't the thing of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor and roll it around for  a bit on your way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, look. No rolling. Nothing needs  to be rolled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy stumbles enters scene with Rocco and Connor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rocco) Where are you goin'? (to Connor) Did you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rocco) Then what the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You don't know that shit for  sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. You're such a fuckin'  retard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your brain for once. Is it so  unbelievable they don't care about  you? You are fuckin' dead, you go in  there today. Dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. You two fuckin' Micks know  what's going on, huh? (flips them off) Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to calm him) Hey, this ain't a thing you should  gamble on, Roc.

dialogues.text: A girl rides by on a bicycle, they pause as she rides bet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it! What kind of flowers ya  want at your funeral? Ya dumb Wop.  This is the last time I'll see you.  Bye-bye ya stupid son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You get in there and start  getting a bad vibe, get the fuck out  quick.

dialogues.text: Connor picks up the place as Murphy watches t.v. The phon rings.

dialogues.text: (trying hard) Here kitty, kitty...... kitty.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SIN BIN SMALL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Smecker ascends the three, small steps up to the round ro A NUDE DANCER sits there on the couch in a robe. She is c as she is being consoled by Detective Duffy. This small r is where men watch girls through a large glass window. In this room a dancer performs on a floor a few feet abov the three private booths where each man watches from his booth. She appears as if on stage. All three windows are  shattered and there is blood on the wall of all three boo We see assorted body parts in each booth, but no faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can she I.D. them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were wearing masks.

dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker looks at Dolly surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only two did the shooting. (beat) So what are you thinking, Russian  retaliation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, too quick half their  infrastructure got taken out at the  Copley plaza. Besides, if you're a  hitter, you're either working for  the Russians or the Italians. There's  no riding the fence. Our little theory  from last night just got blown to  shit. Something... new is going on  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker sits next to the girl. He has Compassion. She Cri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably shouldn't work another shift  for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this job. I'm getting out of  the porno business and I don't care  who I gotta blow to do it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SIN BIN SMALL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: The bodies have been removed and chalk outlines replace t The bullet holes in the walls have been marked either A o B. The detectives watch Smecker. He is a mess. His clothe are disheveled and his hair is frazzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After talking to the dancer we know  that their mark was the guy in the  middle booth. After she watches them  whack him, she passes out. (pause) Why the two extra victims?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way they could have seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker hits an orange button on the wall and a black ste door with a money slot comes slamming down in front of th first booth. He does the same thing to the last booth, le the middle one open. Both doors possess peep holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Allow me to enlighten you gentlemen  to the protocol of the porno industry,  as I'm sure you've never been in one  of these places before. A man goes  into the booth, puts the money in  the slot. The dancer gets it on the  other side. She hits the button,  door goes up, now there is only glass  between you and it's (makes a masturbatory  gesture with hand) little fireman time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way they could have seen it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those doors were down... which means  this. They looked down in through  the peep hole, saw these guys and  opened the doors from the inside.  Pop, pop, pop, right through the  glass. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the three of them had something  in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This guy is big time. (points to middle  booth) These two are street-walking scum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kidding) Then that's what they had in common.  They were all bad guys... now they're  all dead bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker seems side-tracked and ponderous at Greenly's  observation. He hits the orange buttons and raises the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got another thing to think about  here. We got us a genuine Kennedy  assassination style bullet theory.  Two guns were used here, guns A and  B. The guy in the middle was done  with both. But this guy... (denotes right booth) ...he was killed with bullets from  gun A only. And this guy... (denotes left booth) ...gun B only. But ballistics dug  two slugs out of the wall from over  here where the victim was done with  A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker points to two bullet holes in the wall of the boo on the left. Each is marked "B". He walks over to the rig booth where in the exact location are two identical holes marked "A".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's the same story over here.  Why the crossover? (beat) Theories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just fucking weird. I have no  idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. I just can't think anymore.  That scene over at the coffee shop  today tapped me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy went nuts over off of  Commonwealth today. Shot three guys  to death in a coffee shop in broad  daylight. Fled the scene. Don't have  much on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Why was I not informed of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They weren't related. The guy used a  38. No pennies. Totally amateur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were the victims?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of peons for the mob and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (livid) Oh that's just BEAUTIFUL! All the  scumbags in the quiet city of Boston  start dropping dead and you think  it's unrelated?! Greenly, the day I  want the Boston Police doing my  thinking for me, I will have a fucking  tag on my toe! Now, get me a squad  car and get me over there. I want  the crime scene photos and any witness  statements. NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker storms from the room. The detectives begin to fol Smecker comes barreling back in, shoving them out of the  way. He looks at the bullet holes in the walls marked "A B" again. Something has clicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wide-eyed) Oh... it looks like we got us a  cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LAKEVIEW LUNCH NIGHT
dialogues.text: Smecker surveys photos and papers, as he smokes profusely He stands next to a table in the back where chairs are kn over. Body chalk and blood stains are everywhere. The  detectives seem like they don't want to be there, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shooter knew these guys, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends, Gentlemen. They were friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker flashes them a photo of a dead body. The victim i shot in the head and face down in his plate of food. His  hands are on the table in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys were packing. Not one  hand near a gun. It's simple human  behavior. Someone you don't know  approaches you, you put your hand on  it. This guy's got his hands on the  table. He's eating his food, for  Christ sakes. They were friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker looks over the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These two fucking scenes are related.  Too many coincidences. Same day?  Five hours apart? Dead mobsters on  both scenes. Now, why did he kill  the bartender?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crime of passion. He just went nuts.  He would have shot everyone in here.  He just ran out of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duffy. This look like a fucking post  office to you? This guy came in here  with intent. Maybe he didn't know  exactly what he was gonna do but he  had a pretty good idea. The bartender  wasn't a fucking accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we didn't get any help on that.  A lot of people saw it. Nobody's  talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking figures. Look, are you guys  seeing the pattern here? We got big  questions at both of these crime  scenes, with no answers. WHY did  they kill the guys in the other two  booths? WHY did he do the bartender?  It would seem unnecessary, even  stupid. (angry) God, I hate cold crime scenes! I'm  fucking leaving now. And do me a  favor, tell me when the next guy  dies, cause these guys are not done  yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms to the entry way.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LAKEVIEW LUNCH ENTRY WAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: Smecker walks across the street, still angry, and goes to payphone. There's an extreme close-up on his hand as he p in a quarter. As the quarter jingles in...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET IN FRONT OF LAKEVIEW LUNCH DAY
dialogues.text: ...there is a close-up on a hand pulling back from the co slot. The hand moves up to pull a cigarette from its  possessor's mouth. It is Rocco. He dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Murph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roc. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Anybody call for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You sure you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fuckin' fine. (beat) Catch you on the flip side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes across the street and enters Salamone's.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ROCCO'S APARTMENT DAY
dialogues.text: Donna and Rayvie are laying on the couch. Connor is spit- shining his boots by the window. Murphy lights his cigare on the gas stove and pours some salt in a pot of water wi a handful of pennies boiling to a shine in it. Rocco burs through the door, hysterical. Tears are streaming down hi face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack your shit! We gotta get outta  here! We gotta get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopping into his  boots) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed em! Oh, Jesus! I killed em  all!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey. Just calm down. Tell us  what happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Fuck you! You start getting  excited! We gotta fucking go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (packing up gear) Who did you kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (packing up gear) Holy shit. Who? How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rummaging through  his drawers) Hurry the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is some crazy shit, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those cocksuckers sold me out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I fuckin' tell ya, Rocco? They  pull on you first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCCO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I fuckin' do?... in the  middle of the Lakeview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lakeview the deli? Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Ha! Roc, you got a jumbo set of  coconut balls man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCCO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns in rage) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Where's my cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slight pause) I killed your fuckin' cat, you druggie  bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked, hurt) You... oh god, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt it would bring closure to our  relationship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) You killed my... my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, unsure of the cat's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Your what?! Your fuckin' what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts his gun to his  own head) Your what, bitch? I'll shoot myself  in the head, you can tell me that  cats name! Go ahead... Your what?  Your precious little... (waiting for her  response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered, crying) Pee...Per...Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeperman? WRONG? What color was  it?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was... It was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Male or female, bitch?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you yell at her you fuckin'  prick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your fat ass, Rayvie! I can't  buy a pack of smokes without running  into nine guys you fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you yell at her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco rummages through her purse and finds her car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's get the fuck outta  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit. Rayvie and Donna are hugging each other, cryin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my... I mean it's not really...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. It's not fat.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR EARLY EVENING
dialogues.text: Rocco is in the back. Connor is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those rat fucks! All of them were  all laughing at me man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you killed them?

dialogues.speaker: INT. FLASHBACK SALAMONE'S DAY
dialogues.text: Rocco is standing at the back table while his cohorts rem seated. They are OLY, and VINNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin-A-right I did. I had a goddam  turkey shoot over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet it was a test. Vincenzo  came in here shooting his mouth off.  He was makin' sure we knew. But we  did what we were supposed to, eh? We  kept our mouths shut. You did your  part. They know we're goodfellas  now. We'll get taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Did everyone know? Next thing  you'll tell me Sal was in on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco looks at Sal the bartender who reaches for the phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Vincenzo told Sal first. That  fat fuck knew before we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all start laughing together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we got our funny man back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh as Rocco pulls his gun and shoots Oly in t head. He lands face down in his plate of food. He shoots  Vinnie in the chest then turns on Sal. He yells "Funny, f funny" as he pumps the remaining rounds into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody see ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, man! I may as well have posted  flyers. Right out in public, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liberating isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles at last) Y'know it is, a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor pulls over directly in front of a pink neon sign t says The Sin Bin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincenzo, that fat motherfucker,  Yakavetta's right hand. He's the one  who set me up. Then he went around  shooting his mouth off, telling  everyone I was as good as dead. He  goes in there every Wednesday night  around 10:00, he jerks off in the  same booth to the same titty dancer.  Never misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's kill the motherfucker. I  mean, what are you guys... like that's  your new thing right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Murphy) Yeah, well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what the fuck? How do you guys  decide who you're... I mean, who  makes the cut? Is there a raffle or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, truth be known, those first  ones just kinda fell into our laps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what'ya do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we really don't have a system  of deciding who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited, yelling) MEEE! ME! I'm the guy! I know  everyone, their habits, where they  hang out, who they talk to. I know  where they fuckin' live. We could  kill everyone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Connor) So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm strangely comfortable with it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALLEY BEHIND SIN BIN NIGHT
dialogues.text: Rocco, Connor and Murphy are looking very serious as they smoke outside the rear door, in the alley. A drug dealer a hooded Boston Bruins jacket emerges from the opposing a He stops a 13 year-old kid. The kid is scared as the drug dealer slaps him. The kid give him money and the drug dea stuffs a small baggie in the boy's shirt. He lets him go withdraws into the alley. As the boys and Rocco watch this from the opposing alley, they begin to head for them, but Vincenzo's car pulls up  across the street. Rocco stops the boys and denotes Vince The boys head in the front door. Rocco moves back into th alley.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SIN BIN NIGHT
dialogues.text: Vincenzo enters and shuffles past the bar where the broth stand. He walks through a bead curtain at the back of the busy porno house. The boys follow him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SIN BIN HALLWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: They go to the back, open the exit door and let Rocco in. The three wind down long dark hallways with Rocco leading the way until they reach a green door. The boys stand, si by side, directly in front of it. Rocco is just behind th The three pull identical 9mm.'s and the boys pull on thei masks. Rocco puts on a mask that he made from a dock work cotton hat. He looks ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Roc, this is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and is instantly taken with laughter at Rocco's  appearance. Connor turns, and has the same reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You guys got masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now pointing and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through laughter) You look like Mush Mouth from Fat  Albert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes off mask) Fine! Fuck it! When we're done she  can I.D. me. I don't care. Just tryin'  to be professional, but no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still laughing) No. No. It looks good. C'mon, put it  back on. It's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begrudgingly puts it back on. They reassume their posi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating mush mouth) Okay Roc. You sure you're O-B-kay-B?

dialogues.speaker: INT. SIN BIN SMALL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: They burst into the room, climb up a few steps and are in small round room with a couch in it. A topless dancer sit smoking and drinking coffee, on the couch in front of thr big black steel doors with money slots in them. Rocco sei her, puts a hand over her mouth and a gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is he in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the middle door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes his hand off  her mouth) What's his routine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H... h... he jerks off in there.  Th... then he puts money through the  slot and I raise the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to an orange button. Each door has a button to the left of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches me do my thing and f- finishes himself off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SIN BIN CENTER BOOTH NIGHT
dialogues.text: We see the fuzzy reflection of a cheap porno movie being  reflected in Vincenzo's Elvis style sunglasses. He is sha as he masturbates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grunting, muttering) Don't you talk to me like that, you  dirty little... give it to daddy...  give it ta da King... garbage mouth,  garbage mouth.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SIN BIN SMALL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Rocco is looking through the peep hole down on Vincenzo. still holds the terrified, crying dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. He is some sicko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They back up and focus on the money slot. A hundred dolla bill comes through. Connor gives it to the dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've earned this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys begin to recite their prayer. Rocco is smiling a excited, he still hangs on to the now hyperventilating da They press the button. The door goes straight up. Vincenz has one moment of shock before the MacManuses decimate hi through the glass with silenced bullets. The glass silent spiders and begins to fall in spots. His chest explodes,  sputtering medallions and bits of gold chain inside the b The dancer faints and Rocco lays her down gently. The boys step down in the boot and begin their ritual. Rocco watches intently, intrigued. They finish and turn a to see Rocco is immersed in grabbing one of the unconscio dancer's breasts. They pull up their masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I'll tip her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've teamed up with a sex offender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, when are you getting a plastic  fuck doll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I'm sorry. I'm pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and starts tossing money on her as the boys gi Just then two more bills come through the slots of the ot two doors, which have remained closed. Murphy looks throu left peep hole, Connor the right. Smiles spread across th faces and they look at each other. They switch and each l through the other guy's peep hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is like a scumbag yard  sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta come down here once a week  and clean house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco looks in one. He says "Oh, wow" as he crosses and c out the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys look at each other affirmatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. You gotta let me do these  guys. I'm such a moron. I gotta make  up for the tit thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I've been waitin' for this  asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, c'mon. I gotta clear my family  name here. I've brought shame to the  house of Della Rocco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give the guy a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks it over) Rocco, this is the real deal. We  must kill without hesitation, without  guilt or remorse. Evil man, dead  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco gets serious and nods his head. Connor replaces the clip in his gun and hands it to Rocco. Murphy does the sa He stands with one in each hand, aiming one gun at each d The boys both place a finger on the appropriate orange  buttons, as Rocco slowly cocks his head back. With wide e he thrusts his head forward. The doors fly up. Rocco fire both guns yelling "Yeah, take it, take it!" Both the drug dealer from outside and the pimp from the emergency room destroyed. Rocco then crosses his arms and fires two more shots from each gun. On the opposing walls of each booth identical bullet holes appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt-fuckin'-Earp, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys gotta teach me that prayer,  man. That's some good shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. It's a family prayer. My  father, his father before him that  sort of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: INT. RITZY RESTAURANT BATHROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: An old man appears to look at himself in the mirror of an empty but very upper class bathroom. His eyes are very gl over. He puts a large leather case on the counter near th sinks. A red and white blind stick hangs off his right  forearm. Yakavetta enters, crosses behind him and stands next to h AUGUSTUS (72 years) sniffs the air. A look of angry  realization overtakes his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Augustus, I need your help, I  got a serious problem here. I'm not  screwing around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bounced you on my knee at family  reunions, for Christ sakes. Your dad  and me ran the whole east coast  syndicate you snot-nosed little prick.  And when you took the wheel, who was  beside you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augustus begins to remove items from his suitcase. First plate. He sets it down next to the sink. Then assorted  colognes, cigarettes and chewing gum. He begins arranging them in neat rows, always feeling with his guiding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start with your shit. Don't  you talk to me. Oh, hey Uncle Gussy,  thanks for years of service. Here's  a gold watch and a job sniffing other  guys' shit eight hours a day. What  am I, a retired bus driver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need Il Duce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duke?  (beat) What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid, this package boy could  bring down the whole east coast. If  he decides to turn states he could  dismantle us... totally. But it looks  like for now, he's content with just  killing us one by one. And even worse  the kid is good at it. I mean I had  a prodigy on my hands the whole time  and didn't even know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yakavetta puts an envelope of money in the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen kid, I think you better  understand who you're dealing with  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I was only twelve or thirteen  when you guys used to talk about  him, like he was a ghost or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad and I used him three times  over twenty years, only when  everything went totally fucked.  Believe me kid, you don't want this  guy unless you are 100% sure you  need him. He is... a fuckin' monster.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PRISON PROCESSING ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: This is a gigantic three tiered room with guards on all t They all cock their shotguns. A PRISONER is shackled barefoot to a small metal cart on  wheels. His hands are cuffed before him with a chain link his hands and feet. A guard is pulling the cart through t prison to the parole board room by a long chain. The cons have their mirrors out to get a better look. His face is shadow as he bows his head. A metal cage is lowered around him from the ceiling. The  parole board looks him over. A stenographer sits poised

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (English accent) Do you feel you have been  rehabilitated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response is given by the prisoner. The stenographer lo at MR. COBB who gives her the nod. She begins typing thou no words are spoken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had this guy in front of me,  and I couldn't tell you what he looks  like, sounds like. He is the Picasso  of assassins, kid. He plants hair  samples, blood. Puts skin under  fingernails. He is a fucking genius.  Only one problem. He's been rotting  in prison for twenty-five or thirty  years. Don't even know if he's still  alive. Or if he's even up to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augustus hands him a piece of paper he scribbled on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's ways around that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go find one.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PAROLE PROCESSING ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: A large piece of paper is placed on the table and stamped with the words parole granted across it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL ROOM BOSTON DAY
dialogues.text: The prisoner, Il Duce enters. He is clad in a long dark t coat with the collar pulled up, dark round glasses and a  dark hat. He puts a suitcase on the bed. He walks over to the window. He slowly puts his hand outs and watches the sun bounce off it. Tears begin to flow fr beneath his glasses as he breaks down. He begins to take his clothes as he weeps, casting them aside.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HOTEL ROOM FIRE ESCAPE BACK ALLEY DUSK
dialogues.text: The Duke is fully naked, except for a hotel blanket which wrapped around his waist, sitting on the fire escape. He  smiles and is still misty-eyed as he beholds the sun sett Scattered around him are all the furnishings of freedom;  Snickers bars, all kinds of empty candy wrappers, Coke ca and many assorted magazines. INT.  COFFEE HOUSE  NIGHT  2:00 A.M. Rocco and the brothers sit in an old Boston coffee house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk some business here. I  know a sick fuck... makes the ones  we been doing look like altar boys.  Worst night of my life when I met  this guy.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SUBURBAN BEAVER CLEAVER-TYPE HOUSE DUSK
dialogues.text: Rocco waits in a late model Chevelle in front of a white  house. A man exits the house and walks across the sprawli front lawn. Rocco leans over and says How ya doin', man? The man doesn't respond and sits in the passenger seat. During the following scenes we FLASHCUT between bits of  Rocco's experience that night to the coffee house and cat bits of dialogue as he explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy never says a fuckin' word to  me. We're driving for 25 minutes.  Never a sigh, no throat clearing,  nothing. And his face, blank man.  Just nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHCUT: They pull up to a house in a scummy, Boston Log Airport neighborhood. Rocco gets out and sits on the hood smoking as the man makes his way up the walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two tough looking wiseguys walk across a hallway cocking  shotguns. They disappear into a room. FLASHCUT : He quietly enters the house and pulls a large  bright-blue plastic tarp from his coat and spreads it acr the floor in the hallway. We hear the sound of Sega video games being played. He pulls out two pistols with silence and walk. He disappears into the living room. Two white flashes and the sounds of silencers. A hookerish looking mom enters f in the B.G. in the kitchen. She is talking on the phone. disappears from view. The man reappears and walks to the  kitchen. A white flash and the sounds of silencer. He walks right down the hall and halts right in front of and listens. He goes into the room the wiseguys had enter We hear a second of male voices in protest. Two flashes o light and the sounds of silencers. A dog is heard barking The man reappears in the hall and walks to its end, throu the kitchen. He opens a pair of sliding doors and steps o of our view. A flash of white light and the sound of a  silencer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco is out front listening as the barks abruptly cease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHCUT : The man drags a dead dog across the kitchen fl leaving a streak of blood. FLASHCUT : He drags the bodies two kids, two men and the woman down the hall toward us  leaving the hall carpet streaked with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see what he was doing while  he was in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHCUT : The man pulls out a large hunting knife and  disappears into each room. The sounds of hacking are hear He reappears holding different pieces of bloody debris. A telephone, a piece of carpet, pieces of drywall. He takes mop and cleans off the blood on the linoleum of the kitch floor. He walks toward us and stabs the mop in right before came It stays standing. FLASHCUT : We see from his p.o.v. a pile of broken bodies bloody debris and a dead dog with a mop sticking out the  top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHCUT : The man steps outside and motions Rocco in.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BACK FACTORY LOT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Rocco's face is now expressionless as the two load the la body in the furnace and toss the dog in, unloading from  Rocco's trunk. They shut the furnace door and there is ju the low hum of a furnace and the light wind blowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a poker game at the house  every Saturday with a couple of guys  you know. Why don't you come down?  Wife makes a hell of a bar-g-que.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Yeah... yeah, I'd like that. Tell me  something. What did they do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT INT. COFFEE HOUSE NIGHT
dialogues.text: Rocco is looking down in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worst day of my life, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Well, I'm sold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Roc. We'll do this guy  right and you'll feel a lot better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three burst in, all yelling at each other. They are a bleeding profusely from gun shot wounds. Connor turns on gas stove and slams a new clothing iron down on the burne He has wrapped the cord around the handle so it won't bur They have all ripped their clothes haphazardly and have m tourniquets to nurse their wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck was he, Rocco? I know  you fuckin' know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! I told you I never saw him  before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he sure as fuck knew you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you both! Ya ask me, he was  aiming at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene fades into total silence as they viciously argu They then take turns hold each other down as they cauteri their wounds with the hot iron. Two guys will hold a thir down and force a wadded up pillow case in his mouth, as t burn him

Smecker sits on the balls of his fee on a sprawling front lawn. He looks out to the street and sees a forensics  technician kneeling before a new, gray Ford Taurus riddle with bullet holes. The man marks a sea of different-sized bullet casings that stretch for thirty-five feet down the sidewalk. He circles two blood stains on the side walk wi orange chalk. Smecker turns and looks at the front of the house. It is  peppered with bullet holes, all seemingly concentrated on the front stoop area. Men try to lift blood samples off t white paint around the door. He stands and Dolly, Duffy a Greenly are ready with pens and notebooks behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Here's what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor, Murphy and Rocco sit in a parked van, down the st from the Beaver Cleaver house. The three are sitting next each other in the longer back seat. They have a counter i front of them with all their guns and accessories on it. The clicking of bullets into clips, and smacking of clips into guns are heard. Smecker sits in the captain's chair  directly across from them, calmly smoking a cigarette. Th finish their preparation. Rocco holds up his guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They waited in a parked car down the  street for the kid to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy spies a young boy peddling his bike out of the  driveway. He goes to the front of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he goes. (turns back to them,  pulls his guns) Okay, gentlemen. Are we ready to  bring this man into the light? Are  we ready to truly do the work of the  Lord?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocks his pistol) A-fuckin'-men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so fuckin' cool!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SUBURBAN BEAVER CLEAVER TYPE HOUSE DAY
dialogues.text: Connor, Murphy, and Rocco make a frenzied exit from the v and walk across the front lawn, each carrying a black duf bag and clutching a mask. The garage is opened a crack. They pull it up all the way. The sun shines in on Smecker who stands there smoking.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SUBURBAN "BEAVER CLEAVER" TYPE HOUSE GARAGE DAY
dialogues.text: They enter and close the door behind them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They went in through the garage. The  kid says he leaves it open when he  takes his bike out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dive into their bags and suit up with leather gloves masks, navy P-coats and their guns.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SUBURBAN "BEAVER CLEAVER" TYPE HOUSE DAY
dialogues.text: The three open the door and enter the house and walk  deliberately down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, they know the wife is the gate  keeper. She knows the code.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SUBURBAN "BEAVER CLEAVER" TYPE HOUSE BACKYARD DAY
dialogues.text: They walk with the terrified woman around the pool to a s door pool house entrance. There is a number pad next to t door. Rocco positions her in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me lady. I'll kill  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly punches in the numbers. Smecker is standing th smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife says she doesn't know what  happened after she hit the code. She  just remembers going down. But,  judging by the burn mark on her back,  I think what they did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco pulls a stun gun and zaps her with it. She goes dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...was use a stun gun on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor reaches for the knob but Rocco stops him. They wai guns drawn and focus on the door knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the guy knows a friend is coming  to the game. And they know that this  door can only be opened from the  inside. So they wait... and when  that door opens, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knob turns and they kick it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst in and line up shoulder to shoulder, guns aime Smecker stands beside Rocco with his thumb and forefinger extended to mimic guns. Five mafiosos sit around a poker  table in front of time. Two men are playing pool to their left. Rocco quickly scans the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin firing. Men are dying, their chests exploding. Smecker moves his hands like firing guns and yells over t noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody was ready for it. Devastation,  panic! This was like shooting fish  in a fuckin' barrel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker points to the pool table as the two players dive  under it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now these guys dove under the table.  The trajectory on the bullets show  they came from straight across. So  this means one of our shooters...  dropped to his knees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker drops to his knees in perfect synchronicity with  Rocco. They are side by side and leaning back. Rocco fires and the men under the table skip around as th are riddled with bullets. Smecker's mimicking hands follo him perfectly with each shot. The boys and Rocco demask. Rocco goes around to all the bodies and looks earnestly a each one, as Connor and Murphy pick up bullet casings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!... Shit! He ain't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean he ain't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look again for fuck sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what the fuck he looks like!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something went wrong. Right here.

dialogues.speaker: INT. POOLHOUSE BATHROOM DAY
dialogues.text: The man they came for gets off the toilet and pulls up hi pants. He is expressionless. He pulls a towel rack from t wall.

dialogues.speaker: INT. POOLHOUSE DAY
dialogues.text: The door behind Rocco begins to open outward. As the door swings open, Rocco tries to angle a gun around to shoot t man who is opening it. But as soon as the man sees his ha bam! he comes down on it with the towel rack. Rocco pulls back in pain dropping his other gun but the gun fires, as the man's blow connects. The shot pierces his stomach and sends him against the wall. He holds his abdomen in pain. There is a moment of recognition between the man and Rocc Rocco is terrified as the man dives on him and they begin fighting. Murphy jumps to help, but Connor pulls him back They both stand in front of the pool table about thirty f from Rocco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the boy go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is now being choked, as he glares at them in disbelief

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Roc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, one of these guys is a real  sicko. He knew this man. He wanted  him to suffer, to feel every second  of a painful death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rocco is wrestling and punching on the floor. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me you assholes!  (they continue to  cheer) He's gonna fuckin' kill me! (he fights harder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy is one bad motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna die!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy is aching to help but Connor is more steady. A man who has been shot starts to regain consciousness. Connor  turns his back to shoot him (slo-mo). Murphy sees his  opportunity, pulls the cue ball from the table, and rolls silently across the carpet toward Rocco. Connor fires with his left hand and as the casing ejects  from the gun he catches it in mid air and makes the sign the cross. Rocco is on his back, the man is straddling hi They both have each others throats and are trying to stra one another. When the ball is within arms reach, Rocco sl his hand down on it and knocks his assailant in the skull He straddles him and begins to mercilessly beat his face with the cue ball, yelling "You sick fuck!" He finally stops, gets up, runs toward the boys, and thro an exhausted punch at Connor who just lays Roc down on th pool table and says, "Nicely done, boy". Murphy tends to  Roc. Connor checks out the man and seems surprised. Murphy takes the bloody cue ball from Rocco's hand and  polishes it off on his jacket, making sure Connor cannot  see. He replaces it perfectly on the table. Smecker now s in front of the table with the cue shining in the backgro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen wounds like these  before, but whatever he used on this  guy, it was a blunt object and they  took it with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker exits to the left as Greenly enters from the righ following Smecker out. He walks by the table furiously  scribbling in his notebook. Connor, Murphy and Rocco exit the room, pennies in the eyes of all the corpses in the  background. Rocco holds two duffle bags full of poker mon Greenly stops, picks up the cue ball and looks at the dea man. He shakes his head and says, "Nah".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker stands in the middle of the front lawn. His hair a mess. He's chain-smoking. His clothes are disheveled. His eyes are psychotic. He points to the parked Taurus as six men in dark suits appear in a fuzzy, out-of-focus sho They line up shoulder to shoulder on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exited out the front door. And  they had no fucking idea what they  were in for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco, Connor and Murphy walk toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Slo-mo) Two black leather boots slowly walk up the sidew and stop in front of the new, gray Ford Taurus then turn  toward the house. Il Duce removes a white balloon filled  with a few ounces of fluid from the pocket of his black t coat. He throws it on the walk, the blood splatters. He p up the remnants of the balloon and puts them back in his  pocket and stands there waiting, looking at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys come out, Rocco in the middle and slightly ahead them. They look out to the walk, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they are staring at six guys  with guns drawn. It was a fucking  ambush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our three heroes stand, their jaws dropping as their poin of view reveals the Il Duce, standing alone, his hands fo in front of him. Suddenly, he throws open his trench coat to reveal a spec leather vest beneath. Six guns, all different, are holste on the front of it: three on each side extend from just b his collar bones to his abdomen. Connor and Murphy don't  hesitate. They each draw one of their now unsilenced guns from their shoulder holsters and aim, one arm over each o Rocco's shoulders. The Duke draws his top two weapons and aims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this was a fucking bomb dropping  in Beaver Cleaverville! For a few  seconds this place was Armageddon!  There was a fire fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all start shooting at once. The noise is deafening. The Taurus is being pierced and the front of the house is splintering as it is riddled with bullets. Smecker is sti in the middle, hands raised to the heavens, turning circl Rocco's pinky finger gets shot off, sending blood splatte against the house. He dives in the bushes reeling. He pul a gun and starts firing. Murphy catches a bullet in the arm and dives for the bush as well. Il Duce with lightening speed, drops the guns an pulls the next two down as he walks to his right about te feet. He commences firing and the casings hit the sidewal all different calibers and sizes are dropping down the wa It's him and Connor and nobody is backing down. They both grind their teeth as they fire rapidly at each other. At same moment, The Duke gets hit in the arm and Connor take bullet in the leg. The firing ceases for a moment. Connor remains steady and Il Duce looks down at his arm a his own blood splattered on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!... No! No!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the guns and pulls the last two as he moves to t right. He fires with wrath as he screams the word No over and over. Rocco and Murphy return fire from the bushes ye and swearing, as Connor does the same from his position o the stoop. The Duke turns and runs, leaving a sea of casings, and gu that extend for 35 feet down the walk. There are also two blood stains. In a frenzy the boys and Rocco get up and withdraw some s bottles from their bags. The begin spraying all their own blood stains on the stoop and the front of the white hous They then pick up their things and run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker comes back to reality and lights a cigarette in f of Dolly, Duffy, and Greenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it was just one guy with six  guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you let me do the thinking,  huh, genius?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the forensics guys at the front of the house begins to walk over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is taking so long with those  blood samples?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get a good sample. There is  variable here I'm not seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker puts his finger through a big blood stain on the  door and smells it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in shock, and rage) They used ammonia... none of this  shit is any good... Fuck... You know  what this means?! Even if we get  suspects in this case, we got  nothing... Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts kicking the bushes and trying to tear them with his hands as he rages. The police and forensics all back  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Who the fuck are they?! I've never  seen any-fucking-thing like this in  my whole fucking life. Who the fuck  are they?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs against the building and slides down to a sittin position in the bushes as if he has given up. He raises h head and there he sees Rocco's pinky finger lying undisco in the bushes. He pulls a small plastic bag from his pock and scoops it up. He shoves it back into his pocket and r off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's it?!

dialogues.speaker: INT. ROCCO'S MOM'S KITCHEN NIGHT
dialogues.text: Rocco, Connor, and Murphy are sitting around the table. They are numb with pain and silently sipping beers. Sudde Smecker comes on the news making an announcement that he heading up the investigation to find the three of them. Rocco shuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (points to TV) What, that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the guy that got us off the  hook with the "Checkov" thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he is one smart man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy is very sharp. If he hasn't  figured us out yet, he will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your ass he will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd say that makes him a lia- fuckin-bility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't to be touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... whatever. (looking at the bloody  mess) My Mom's gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SMECKER'S BEDROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Smecker is sitting at a computer terminal. He has just ho into the F.B.I.'s computer network with his authorization code. He is disgusted as he puts on surgical gloves and f prints the severed finger onto a scanner. He waits for a  moment. Rocco's face and rap sheet come up on his screen. is in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This is all wrong. David Della  Rocco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco on the steps of the police station when Rocco broug the boys their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT INT. SMECKER'S BEDROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: He picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boston Police Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maria, this is Smecker. Could  you find me the visitor's list for  the day the MacManus brothers were  in and read me all the names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reads a few names then hits David Della Rocco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs us, puts in a smoke, and knocks his head back in deep thought.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GAY BAR NIGHT
dialogues.text: Smecker is drinking like a fiend. He is disturbed and row He's a bad drunk. He downs a shot and motions for another one. The BARTENDER comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had quite a bit, Paul. Are  you sure you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pour the drink, faggot-ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He obeys. A good looking gay man comes up and whispers in Smecker's ear and points to the back room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... But I don't cuddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They proceed to the back. Smecker is stumbling.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET IN FRONT OF CHURCH EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Rocco pulls Vincenzo's car to the curb and the MacManus'  exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! We gotta talk about this early  morning church shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go now. (giggles) We're on the lamb.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET IN FRONT OF THE GAY BAR EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Smecker staggers out of the bar. He is an absolute wreck. Rocco exits a package store just down the street. He is  opening a new pack of cigarettes. He is surprised when he sees Smecker at the other end of the block. He follows th stumbling agent, fumbling for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET IN FRONT OF CHURCH EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Paul sees a church and reflects for a moment before cross the street and going in, Rocco a safe distance behind.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHURCH EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Connor and Murphy are at prayer in the back of the church It is mostly empty because of the early hour. Connor looks up and sees Smecker and Rocco way up in the  front. His eyes are ablaze. He is up and walking and does not bother Murphy, who remains penitent. There are two  confessional booths with a priest booth in the middle. Smecker goes in the booth on the far left. Rocco tries th door, it's locked. A middle-aged PRIEST slips a key in th priests booth and opens the door. Rocco shoves him in and goes in behind him. Connor has quickened his pace. He tri both doors. They're locked. He goes into the confessional the right.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHURCH PRIEST'S BOOTH EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Rocco puts his gun to the priest's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna do what I say, got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you're gonna hafta see  this. Don't look at me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I didn't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHURCH CONNOR'S CONFESSIONAL EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Connor is furiously working his fingers through the latti work to open the slider to the priest's booth from his si

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHURCH PRIEST'S BOOTH EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Rocco takes the priest and puts his face in front of the  slider to Smecker's booth, gun to the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you no fear of God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's who I'm doing this for, now  open the fuckin' thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor gets the slider open. Rocco's long hair hangs just inches from Connor's face. Connor puts his thumb and  forefinger through, desperately reaching for a lock of Ro hair. Rocco jostles the priest and puts the gun hard to h head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I'll do you right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly obey,  whispering) God have mercy on my soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco starts to move the priest aside and put his gun to  Smecker's now open slider. Just then Connor snags a piece of Rocco's hair and pulls back hard and fast by it, until his head slams into the  lattice work. Rocco grabs the priest back into position. Connor grabs a nice wad of Rocco's hair with his left han so that the side of Rocco's face is now pressed to the  lattice. Connor then puts a gun to Rocco's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard whisper) You little fuck. Let him go. I'll  drop you right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just calm down. He could hurt  us, brother. He could ruin the whole  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go or I will deliver you,  right now. (pulls hammer back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't do it Connor, you won't.  You love me man.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHURCH CONFESSIONAL BOOTHS EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Smecker wakes up from a drunken stupor. He looks through slider window at the barely discernible face of the now c priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurred, loud) Hello? You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y-Yes my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Do your thing Father. Don't fuck  this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Rocco) What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be natural, goddamit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long since your last confession,  my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ, uh, I've never confessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest can hear Connor and Rocco whisper, but Smecker cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the dogma of the Catholic  church, I should probably burst into  flames right here in this booth. But  I've come here for advice, not  salvation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor and Rocco stop and listen now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you come to a church for  council if you're not religious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ponderous) Why have I come to a church? I never  have before. I guess I just... felt  I should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ethics. I put evil men behind  bars, but the law has miles of red  tape and loopholes for these...  cocksuckers to slip through. I've  found out there are these two young  men who fix the situation with an  iron fist. As if they have God's  permission. But what they do is wrong  and I should arrest them...  technically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's permission? God doesn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco shakes the priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in this day and age I believe  what they do is... necessary. I feel  it is... correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel? A soul is what gives you  feelings. Happiness, guilt, right or  wrong. It is a conduit through which  the Lord speaks to us. You felt that  your answers would be here in the  house of God today. You feel these  men are necessary. The Lord has spoken  to you twice this day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco and Connor show their individual looks of surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Has he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have entered the house of the  Lord of your own free will speaking  of beliefs and feelings. Is it so  much to believe that God has brought  you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is easy to be sarcastic about  religion. It is harder to take small  hints from God, your feelings and  listen to them... to take a stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look of surprise on Rocco and Connor's faces show tha the priest is doing a hell of a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those who do not act are in a constant  state of ethical indecision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to stand for what I believe  in, father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must find out what your  beliefs are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe these young men are right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know them personally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they would harm an  innocent man, for any reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They would never do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest starts to show signs of anger as he starts tur to Rocco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the two Irish guys wouldn't.  But the Italian guy, he might. He's  kind of an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear returns to the priests face. Rocco presses the gun h to the priests head and jostles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to priest) Goddam right, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to see. I've been doing  my job... well for fifteen years and  it's just not enough. All the things  I wish I could do, these guys are  doing. Millions of dollars in tax  payers' money wasted on shit like  wire taps and surveillance. Theses  boys go in and take care of it for  the price of a bullet. (looks up) Ww-what do you think I should do?  Because I'm a law man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco jostles the priest again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laws of God are higher than the  laws of man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the clouds have lifted) Yes! Yes! I was thinking that, too.  No. I was feeling it. All I needed  was to hear you say it! Amen! I'll  help them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Forgive me father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Father, thank you. (he attempts the sign  of the cross but  screws it up) Whatever. Goodbye, amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker exits and they all let go after a brief pause. Ro turns and starts fixing up the priest's ruffled suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have, uh, killed you,  Father.  (signs cross) Dominus Ominus. Remember, you're  bound. You can't talk about this...  to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go!

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHURCH EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Rocco exits the booth and shuts the door behind him. Conn is standing outside, hands on his hips. Rocco smiles at h as Connor fumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling) The Lord works in mysterious ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor slaps him in the back of the head and kicks him in the ass. Rocco's still giggling as they exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you can give me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shoot alternating coverage between the two locations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the light caught the side of  his face for a second. And it looked  like he had a gray beard, maybe...  late fifties, early sixties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're telling me it was one guy  with six guns? A-and he was a senior  fucking citizen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's better if we find this  man before he finds us again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do. How do I get  in touch with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to hit Poppa Joe tonight,  right in the comfort of his own home.  Then we move on to New York. It's  getting a bit hot for us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tonight, afterwards. (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: INT. RITZY RESTAURANT BATHROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Smecker stands beside Augustus, just the way Yakavetta di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who he is. Nobody does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker tosses an envelope of cash in his plate, just as  Yakavetta did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he bring him in for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needed an outsider. The package boy  knows everyone. He'd spot our hitters  a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's the one shooting up all  his guys, right? He's scared of the  kid. Says he's real good, got every  available gun in the city up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up his house. I don't know what's  going on but I know it's gotta have  something to do with this kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck! (runs out)

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT HALL NIGHT
dialogues.text: There are several bodies in the hall, some with pennies i their eyes, some without. Down the dark basement halls th is more gore. The boys and Rocco can be heard screaming f a room in the basement. Yakavetta's voice is heard yellin and in command.

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Connor, Murphy, and Rocco are all hand cuffed to chairs i the seated position. Their clothes are ripped and they ha been beaten severely. Blood covers them. Rocco has been  uncuffed and two men hold his open hand up as Yakavetta p a pistol at the base of his remaining pinky finger. Sever other hold him down as he and the boys scream in tough  protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) You gonna tell me what's going on  here?! Huh! You little fuck! Gimme  some answers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all yell for him to fuck off. Although Rocco is  terrified, he is holding out. Yakavetta fires and Rocco's finger is gone. The blood splatters on Connor's face. Roc screams in pain saying fuck you through his sobs. After r cuffing Rocco, Yakavetta and his goons exit.

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT HALL NIGHT
dialogues.text: Yakavetta is in the hall with four men. GENO (35 yrs.) ve big. CHAPPY (22 yrs.) wears sunglasses even in the dark,  trying to look cool. HOJO (28 yrs.) is slick and good-loo Another Mafioso cohort is with them as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you guys think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're tough. No way they're gonna  talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Rocco. He ain't smart enough  for this shit. These other guys are  the brains. He's just a player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one way to get them to  talk.

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: He walks back into the room. He saunters up to Rocco very nonchalantly and shoots him in the chest. His chair is bl back to the floor. The boys are screaming and crying as  Yakavetta walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggles to talk) You guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) We're here brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) We'll keep going, Roc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll make it outta here. You can't  ever stop, not ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rocco dies, they fall into prayer.

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE FRONT FOYER NIGHT
dialogues.text: Yakavetta lights up a cigar and talks to his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you set him in motion, you can't  call him off. He thinks it's still  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yakavetta stops as if terrified with a thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't have my name spray  painted on the front of this house.  There are no big pictures of me  anywhere. If this guy thinks the job  is still a go then I got green money  says the mother fucker's out in the  bushes already. I'm fucking gone!  I'm leaving you guys to deal with  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four guys are left alone. They all look far from conf except for Geno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One fucking guy, so what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take the front. (points) You guys cover those other exits and  if you see him, don't flag him down,  just kill the mother fucker. I'm  going back down to work on these  pricks.

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Murphy has scootched his chair in front of Connor's. He h his back to Connor. He stretches his neck over and bites at the collar of his coat. He gathers as much of the material in his mouth as can. He starts to yell, "Do it!" but it is muffled. Connor, still sobbing, begins to kick his brother's left  hand repeatedly. He turns it into a bloody piece of broke meat as Murphy screams through the shirt. Finally, it is  broken enough and Murphy pulls it through the cuff. He stands and breaks the chair into pieces and grabs the  sharpest piece. Hojo enters and Murphy shoves the sharp s up through the bottom of his chin into his head. He drags him around the room yelling mumbo jumbo into his face as  Connor jumps up and down in his chair in rage, wanting a  piece of the action. Murphy throws the man down and Connor proceeds to vicious kick his dead body. The two have turned into barbarians. Murphy removes the man's two guns, shiny nickel-plated 45

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S FRONT FOYER NIGHT
dialogues.text: There is a knock at the door. Geno jumps with fright and  then looks out the peep hole. He sees a well-formed pair woman's breasts in a cheap dress. He opens the door. A  stunning blonde stands before him. She looks like a hooke She wears a short, hot pink dress and a white scarf aroun her neck, as well as six inch platform heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey Bevo sent me over. As  entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman speaks and it is apparent that this is actually Smecker in drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen baby. Tonight ain't the night  for this shit.  (beat) Bevo's so great. Always sending us  hot girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you could use a quickie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smecker kisses him full on the lips and rubs up against h Geno is convinced. He brings her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chappy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chappy, emerges way  down the hall) What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't been laid in a week. Take  five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I die cause you're getting a piece  of ass, I'll come back and beat you  to death with a big rubber dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE NIGHT
dialogues.text: He takes Smecker into a small bathroom adjoining the foye They are instantly in the throws of passion. They grope e other and Smecker cleverly avoids any contact with his cr Smecker lies down on the floor and starts to wiggle and  seductively touch himself. Geno stands over him, straddli Smecker's hips as he undoes his pants. Suddenly, Smecker  grabs both of Geno's ankles and has him locked in positio He repeatedly kicks Geno in the balls from his lying posi on the floor. The guy falls on his back unconscious. Smec uses a silencer, shoots him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE HALL NIGHT
dialogues.text: He starts to whisper, "It's on now. It's on now. Too far. as he walks down the hall, striding in his high heels, wi back in place. He thoughtlessly blows Chappy away as he p his position and runs down a long hallway. He turns a cor and points his gun at the Mafioso cohort but pauses. He is already sitting with his throat cut. Smecker looks  puzzled as Il Duce withdraws from the shadows behind him. The Duke pistol whips Smecker. He's out.

dialogues.speaker: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Connor and Murphy are on their knees in front of Rocco, w they have sat back up in the chair. They are gently placi pennies in his eye and sobbing as they begin to recite th prayer. As they speak, Il Duce watches. He then begins to whisper the prayer right along with them. Their words mat up perfectly. He leans against the wall, holsters his gun and withdraws a cigarette. He rolls it along his tongue and twists it into his lips. The boys are still reciting as he strikes a match. They r instantly. Still kneeling they each point a nickel-plated toward The Duke. They turn in time to see the light from match illuminate his face. Il Duce pauses then he strides into the room and proceeds to recite the last half of the prayer. He stops between the kneeling boys and finishes off the  prayer. The boys are stunned as they realize this is thei father. He makes the sign of the cross over Rocco. Then h looks down to the upturned faces of his sons. He places a hand on each of their cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHEAP BOSTON HOTEL ROOM NIGHT 3 MONTHS LATER
dialogues.text: Both sleeping boys throw their arms out, mimicking a cruc Christ. Their father turns, sees this, turns back. The boys wake with a start. Connor looks to his father, w is already staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far are we going with this, Da?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The questions is not, "how far?" The  question is, "Do you possess the  constitution, the depth of faith to  go as far as is needed?"

dialogues.speaker: INT. COURTHOUSE BACK FOYER AREA MORNING
dialogues.text: Smecker opens the door from the inside and lets the MacMa father and sons in. He walks one way they walk the other  through the grand courthouse halls.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COURTROOM MORNING
dialogues.text: The media, with their cameras and notebooks, are at the b of the courtroom. Yakavetta is testifying on the stand. H is cocky. The judge warns Yakavetta that he will have no  more of this behavior in his courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to #2) Look at his charisma. He's the next  John Gotti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll walk. Even with all this  evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. (points to the left  and right sections  of courtroom seating) All Yakavetta's people are on the  right. All the families of the men  he has killed are on the left.  Everyone wants some justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him. He doesn't have a care  in the world. He's gonna walk.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FOYER TO COURTROOM DAY
dialogues.text: The MacManusus stand in the foyer. There are a pair of do that go to the outside hallway and a pair that go to the  inside courtroom. There is an armed guard directly inside the courtroom, in front of the doors. The door opens a crack and Connor waves the guard into th foyer and starts talking to him. Then dad zaps him with a stun gun. The guard is on the floor, incapacitated and  drooling as the boys handcuff him. Connor pulls out a length of chain and drapes it through door handles that lead from the hall into the foyer. He l them in with a padlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do these put a man down  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father zaps the incapacitated man a second time as he lay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty is a bit better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They suit up, Connor and Murphy in their usual masks and  gloves, Dad is already in his usual dark hat and glasses. The boys start for the courtroom door but dad gently hold them back. He takes a moment, then slowly removes his hat and glasses. His sons look at one another and then remove their masks. The three look into each others eyes for a  moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
