dialogues.text: Due to the lack of hard evidence......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three burst in, guns drawn, and are walking down the  aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All media to the back! Drop the  cameras! Drop 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, they all obey. Connor and Murphy pull Yakavett from the witness booth by his hair and place him on his k just before the judge's bench. They face him toward the  occupants of the courtroom. The father walks up and motio for the judge, who is now banging his gavel and shouting protest, to come off the stand. As soon as he is within arms reach, dad takes him by the  collar and drags him down the aisle all the way to where media stands in horror. He turns and walks back down the  aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) You people have been chosen to reveal  our existence to the world. You will  witness what happens here today and  you will tell of it afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes to the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to his  comrades) Fuckin' do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father keeps them covered. He passes the front, he lo and sees a VIRGINAL-LOOKING WOMAN with her head down cryi into her hands. She is on the left side. He gently tilts chin forward, her eyes fixated on a faded blue butterfly the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) You must watch dear. It'll all be  over soon.  (she obeys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father takes out a flask. He pours the booze on the j bench and set it ablaze. Fire alarms start to sound. Connor and Murphy jump up on the lawyers' tables. Murphy the prosecution side, Connor on the defense. The father h his sawed-off to the back of Yakavetta's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over the  alarm) Now, you will receive us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over the  alarm) We do not ask for your poor or your  hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do not want your tired and sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is your corrupt we claim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is your evil, who will be sought  by us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With every breath we shall hunt them  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each day we will spill their blood  till it rains down from the skies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not kill, do not rape, do not  steal. These are principles which  every man of every faith can embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are not polite suggestions.  They are codes of behavior and those  that ignore them will pay the dearest  cost. (points to Yakavetta)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are varying degrees of evil.  We urge you lesser forms of filth (pointing to  Yakavetta's people) Not to push the bounds and cross  over into true corruption... into  our domain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For if you do, there will come the  day when you look behind you and see  we three. And on that day you will  reap it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we will send you to whatever God  you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor and Murphy jump off the table. They approach Yakav and stand on either side of their father. All three men h guns to his head and recite the prayer. As they speak, th right side of the courtroom screams in protest. The left  watches in wide-eyed terror, although some men encourage  them to do it. The MacManus' read the prayer. They do not falter as the flames rage behind them. Yakavetta, accepting his fate, closing his eyes. Peaceful he does the sign of the cross. The all fire at once. The  room explodes in confusion. The three exit the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MacManuses are all shackled and in blue jumpsuits of Boston lock-up facility with bags over their heads. Duffy in full uniform with a shotgun behind them. Smecker is le the prisoners down the hall. He flashes his F.B.I.  identification to every cop he encounters.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COURTHOUSE INSIDE GRANDE FOYER STEPS DAY
dialogues.text: The media is in a frenzy. Little bits of the story are kn The people from the left and right sides of the courtroom are yelling and pushing each other as cameras and microph try to pick up the news. Finally all the focus comes to t virginal woman who had been sitting in the front row. All lights, cameras and microphones are on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Were you in the courtroom miss?  Did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frail) Yes. I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about what they did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Slo-mo) She sees at the grande hall's end Smecker leadin the three out, bags still over their heads. She sees Dad' butterfly tattoo. She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we all know what is right  and wrong. We all know. Nobody needs  to be convinced of what he was...  I'm going home now to have my first  real full night's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people who had been on Yakavetta's side of the courtr threaten her and force their way through the crowd toward her, thus causing the two sides to fight. Everyone, even  reporters are in it. The camera tilts up ending on the st of the Blind Lady of Justice.
